values.Name: Name
values.Admin-Explain: Can administrate the organization settings (users, etc.)

values.ProjectMangement_Description: The process of leading/administering the work of a team to achieve all project goals within the given constraints.
values.MasterPlan_Description: A comprehensive and long-term outline or strategy for the development of a specific area, site, or project.
values.Planning_Description: The initial stage of a project where professionals develop a comprehensive strategy and framework for its execution.
values.PreDesign_Description: The initial stage of a project where the focus is on understanding and defining the project's goals, requirements, and constraints. This phase involves gathering and analyzing information essential for developing a successful design strategy.
values.Schematic_Description: The phase of design where concepts and ideas generated in the planning phase start to take more concrete shape.  The outcome of the schematic design phase is a refined and agreed-upon concept that serves as the basis for further development.
values.DesignDev_Description: The phase where the initial design concepts from earlier phases (e.g. SD) are refined and developed into a more detailed and comprehensive plan. This phase involves converting the approved schematic design into a more concrete and technically refined plan/layout.
values.ConstructionDocs_Description: The comprehensive set of detailed drawings, specifications, and written instructions that serve as a guide for contractors and construction teams during the building phase of a project. These documents provide the necessary information and instructions to accurately execute the design as intended by the architects and engineers.
values.Permitting_Description: The process of obtaining official approval or authorization from relevant governmental or regulatory bodies to proceed with a construction project.
values.Bidding_Description: The process in which contractors or construction firms submit proposals or competitive bids to undertake a construction project.
values.ConstructionAdmin_Description: The oversight and management of a construction project during the actual building phase.
values.NepaProcess_Description: Compliance required in projects using federal money helps regulators make informed decisions considering environmental factors and public input before proceeding with a project.

values.BuildingsResidential_Description: Structures primarily designed and constructed for housing purposes (single-family, multi-family, affordable, custom, etc.)
values.BuildingsCommercial_Description: Structures primarily designed and constructed for non-residential or business purposes (offices, retail, hospitality, restaurants, entertainment, etc.)
values.BuildingsInstitutional_Description: Structures designed and constructed to serve various institutional or public service purposes (education, government, healthcare, cultural, etc.).
values.EmergencyManagement_Description: The systematic approach, planning, and implementation of strategies and measures to prevent, prepare for, respond to, and recover from emergencies, disasters, or crises that may impact built environments or communities.
values.Environmental_Description: Projects including considerations, practices, and principles that focus on the relationship between built environments and the natural environment, aiming to create sustainable, healthy, and harmonious spaces.
values.LandDevelopment_Description: Projects that transform undeveloped areas into usable real estate.
values.Transportation_Description: Projects and/or systems and infrastructure that facilitate the movement of people and goods from one place to another.
values.WaterResources_Description: Projects focused on the management, utilization, conservation, and development of water-related assets and systems that support human activities, ecosystems, and various industries (flood control and protection, navigation, water supply).
values.WaterTreatment_Description: The process of purifying, disinfecting, and conditioning water to make it safe and suitable for various purposes, including drinking, industrial processes, irrigation, and recreational use.
values.WasteWaterTreatment_Description: The process of treating and purifying wastewater, including sewage and industrial wastewater, to remove contaminants, pollutants, and harmful substances before releasing the treated water back into the environment or reusing it for various purposes.

values.ActivateUserConfirm: Are you sure you want to activate this user?
values.DeactivateUserConfirm: Are you sure you want to deactivate this user?

values.UploadTaskIntro: Select the file you want to upload...
values.CancelProjectConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel this project?
values.DeleteTaskQuestion: Why are you deleting this task?
values.SubmitForApprovalError: You cannot submit for approval because this project doesn't have any approvers assigned. Please go to Settings -> Roles and select at least one approver.
values.SubmitForApprovalSuccess: The project is ready for approval.
values.SubmitForApprovalConfirm: Are you sure you want to submit this project for approval?
values.DisciplineRemoveConfirm: You are about to remove a discipline which is currently assicated with {count} task(s). Are you sure?
values.PhaseRemoveConfirm: You are about to remove a phase which has {count} task(s) under it. Are you sure?
values.ArchiveProjectConfirm: Are you sure you want to archive this project?
values.ReturnToPlanningConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel the approval process and return to the planning phase?
values.ReturnToPlanningSuccess: The project is now back in the planning phase.
values.RejectProjectConfirm: Are you sure you want to reject the project and return to the planning phase?
values.RejectProjectSuccess: The project is now back in the planning phase.
values.ApproveProjectConfirm: Are you sure you want to approve this project?
values.ApproveProjectSuccess: The project has been approved and is ready for execution.

values.GettingStarted_Description: This is some basic information about creating a new project. This page may not be needed but we're going to include it for now.
values.Basics_Description: Please provide the title for this project.
values.Category_Description: Pick the category that best describes this project.
values.Lib_Hand_Description: How do you want to get started?
values.Wbs_Heir_Description: Would you like the first significant digit of your project to be Phases or Disciplines?
values.Phases_Description: Choose which phases which apply to your WBS. You can then drag them to your organization's preference.
values.Disciplines_Description: Choose which disciplines which apply to your WBS. You can then drag them to your organization's preference.
values.From_Library_Description: Search through our amazing library of project template.
values.By_Hand_Description: Create your project plan by hand to match exactly what your team is looking for.
values.PhaseFirst_Description: Build the project plan by phase with the ability to view it by discipline.
values.DisciplineFirst_Description: Build the project plan by discipline with the ability to view it by phase.
values.Roles_Description: Setup the roles for this project. You must have atleast one PM to continue.
values.Saving_Description: We are working hard to create your new project.

values.GetStartedMessage: To get started upload your project plan using the control below. Once uploaded we will guide you through the rest of the process.
values.UploadInstruction: Drag or click to select your project plan
values.OtherFileDescription: This file will be submitted for a manual upload.
values.TicketOtherMessage: You have uploaded a file that is not currently supported in our do-it-yourself upload system.
values.TicketSubmitted: Your WBS file has been submitted for review. We will contact you shortly to initiate the process.
values.TicketDescription: Please provide us with all information possible to help us understand and manually process your WBS.
values.TicketErrormessage: An error occurred when our system tried to upload your file into the project plan. If you wish to have our team help you upload this file manually, please provide us more with any information that would help us upload your file into the system.
values.PhaseMessage: The main purpose of this tool is to help you build better work breakdown structures. To achieve this we need to understand more about the project plan as it currently stands. Also this will help us provide  opportunities within your plan.
values.OptionsMessage: Do you want to overwrite any existing project plan with the uploaded one or append to the end?
values.DisciplineMessage: While we don't store who is assigned to certain tasks we can use this information to figure out what disciplines are assigned to each task. If you can define what disciplines each individual performs we will do the mapping.
values.UploadError: Unexpected errors occured uploading the file. More explanations of these errors at a later time

values.ByRoleNote: To Change roles go to the "By User" tab.
values.AddUserConfirmation: Are you sure you want to give {USER_NAME} the role of {ROLE_NAME}?
values.RemoveUserConfirmation: Are you sure you want to remove {USER_NAME} from the role of {ROLE_NAME}?

values.Phases: Your project's phases has been defined.
values.PhasesWarn: We usually suggest having more than 2 phases.

values.PageNotFoundDescription: We are not sure how you got here, but there's nothing to see.
values.InviteNotFoundDescription: No invite was found for the code provided.
values.InviteCancelledDescription: The invite has been cancelled. Please contact whoever manages your organization to understand why.

values.Title: Organization Settings
values.MemberRemoveConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove this member from your organization?
values.MemberRolesUpdated: The member's roles have been updated.
values.InviteEmailHint: Enter the email addresses (seperated by comma) of the people you want to invite.
values.CancelInviteConfirm: Are you sure you want to cancel this invite?
values.ResendInviteConfirm: Are you sure you want to resend the invite? This will cause the previous invite sent to be invalid.

values.TaskTitleChangedDescription: The title was changed from '{from}' to '{to}'.
